reviews.review_msg: Grading for assignments and exams were fair - final exam was difficult and midterm was easy. He is late when releasing grades for assignments and exams. Somewhat disorganized, as there were times during lecture when he wasn't certain of something he was driving to prove. He is helpful if you seek his help outside of class and he's really funny.

Not very good with time management during lectures. Spends a lot of time with simple topics then blasts through the hard topics with no introduction. Spends most of his time going through proofs instead of actual examples , so if you want to do well on the exam, the textbook exercises are way more helpful.

Not prepared for lectures and spends too much time going through irrelevant proofs that aren't helpful for assignments/exams. During one lecture, he stopped during a proof because he did not remember how to work it out. The assignments/exams were fairly easy, but lecturing skills were poor.

The exams and assignment questions were fair, but he is in a bad lecturer. He's disorganized, as he gets lost in his own proofs and doesn't understand his slides. Each set of slides seem to have at least one mistake. He does not release grades until far after the exams/assignments are complete. But, he is accessible outside of class for extra help.

The only thing I can say is that if you're having trouble, go to his office hours. He can be a little disorganized during lecture but I guarantee you'll be able to clear things up if you talk to him in private. Yes, his exams are hard but they get scaled.
